Jx.Tree.Folder

A Jx.TreeFolder is an item in a tree that can contain other items.  It is expandable and collapsible.

Example

Extends
<Jx.Widget.list>
License
Copyright © 2008, DM Solutions Group Inc.
This file is licensed under an MIT style license
Summary
Jx.Tree.FolderA Jx.TreeFolder is an item in a tree that can contain other items. 
Options
label{String} the label to display for the TreeItem
contextMenu{<Jx.ContextMenu>} the context menu to trigger if there is a right click on the node
enabled{Boolean} the initial state of the TreeItem. 
image{String} URL to an image to use as the icon next to the label of this TreeItem
imageClass{String} CSS class to apply to the image, useful for using CSS sprites
openis the folder open?  
Functions
renderCreate a new instance of Jx.Tree.Folder
TODO
should we keep this in?  Can it be overridden by a plugin?
Functions
addadd one or more items to the tree at a particular position in the tree
expandExpands the folder
collapseCollapses the folder
findChildGet a reference to a child node by recursively searching the tree
setBusyset the busy state of the widget



Options



label
{String} the label to display for the TreeItem



contextMenu
{<Jx.ContextMenu>} the context menu to trigger if there is a right click on the node



enabled
{Boolean} the initial state of the TreeItem.   If the TreeItem is not enabled, it cannot be clicked.



image
{String} URL to an image to use as the icon next to the label of this TreeItem



imageClass
{String} CSS class to apply to the image, useful for using CSS sprites



open
is the folder open?   false by default.



Functions



render
render : function()
Create a new instance of Jx.Tree.Folder



TODO



should we keep this in?  Can it be overridden by a plugin?



Functions



add
add: function(item,
position)
add one or more items to the tree at a particular position in the tree
Parameters
item{<Jx.TreeItem>} or an array of items to be added
position{mixed} optional location to add the items.   By default, this is ‘bottom’ meaning the items are added at the end of the list.  See Jx.Widget.List::add for options
Returns
{Jx.Tree} a reference to this object for chaining calls



expand
expand : function()
Expands the folder
Returns
{Jx.Tree.Folder} a reference to this for chaining



collapse
collapse : function()
Collapses the folder
Returns
{Jx.Tree.Folder} a reference to this for chaining



findChild
findChild : function(path)
Get a reference to a child node by recursively searching the tree
Parameters
path{Array} an array of labels of nodes to search for
Returns
{Object} the node or null if the path was not found



setBusy
setBusy: function(state)
set the busy state of the widget
Parameters
busy{Boolean} true to set the widget as busy, false to set it as idle.









render : function()
Create a new instance of Jx.Tree.Folder

add one or more items to the tree at a particular position in the tree

Expands the folder
collapse : function()
Collapses the folder

Get a reference to a child node by recursively searching the tree
setBusy: function(state)
set the busy state of the widget
add: function(item,
position)
add an item to the list of items at the specified position
Jx.Tree displays hierarchical data in a tree structure of folders and nodes.
A Jx.TreeFolder is an item in a tree that can contain other items.
